titleStmt.title: On the memory of Mr. Caleb Skinner, and Mr. Hezekiah Middleton; merchants. Who were drowned at Black-wall, coming from on board a ship the 5th of May. 1688. / By a school-fellow of Mr. Skinners.
On the memory of Mr. Caleb Skinner, and Mr. Hezekiah Middleton; merchants. Who were drowned at Black-wall, coming from on board a ship the 5th of May. 1688. / By a school-fellow of Mr. Skinners.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J.H. for the use of the friends of the deceased.,

notesStmt.note: "May 25. 1688. This may be printed. Robert Midgley."
Verse: "Patience a while, unruly tears! My pen".
Reproduction of original in the British Library.

person.persName: the use of the friends of the deceased.
